Lacey Almond Cookies

Mar 19, 2020 • Hannah

This is another work-in-progress recipe. Brittany challenged me to make a gluten free cookie based on the flavors of a ferrero rocher chocolate, and I'll admit I have thus far failed to come through. However! I did make some progress in the form of this almond cookie. My goal was to partially dip the cookie in chocolate, and then roll it in crushed hazelnuts. But after about four separate attempts I've...taken a sabbatical...from this challenge

But regardless, the cookie itself is super tasty, really light, and gluten free! It is super neutral and would pair well with fresh berries, whipped cream, or a bit of hot fudge depending on what you have on hand!



Lacey Almond Cookies
Ingredients
3/4 cup almond flour
1/2 cup unsalted butter
1/2 cup white sugar
1 tbsp gluten free flour
1 tbsp cream
1 tbsp whole milk

Directions
1. Preheat oven to 350F

2. Combine all ingredients in saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until butter melts

3. Spoon teaspoon-fulls onto parchment-lined cookie sheet and lightly spread out the dollops

4. Bake 7-9 minutes
